alert.note: Alert for Jasper; Jones; Lamar; Monroe; Putnam (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued March 26 at 9:35AM EDT until March 26 at 3:45PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: The National Weather Service in Peachtree City has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southern Jasper County in central Georgia... Northwestern Jones County in central Georgia... Northern Monroe County in central Georgia... Putnam County in central Georgia... Lamar County in west central Georgia... * Until 345 PM EDT Sunday. * At 935 AM EDT, Radar and automated rain gauges have estimated between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Barnesville, Eatonton, Forsyth, Milner, Aldora, Adgateville, Hillsboro, McElheneys Crossroads, Juliette, Round Oak, Berner, Plant Scherer, Stanfordville, Blount, Willard, Ethridge, Resseaus Crossroads, Collier, Warfield and Johnstonville. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
